data.title: Urho2D PIXEL_SIZE removal
data.body:
Hello,

I see no point in keeping this variable so here is a PR that removes it.
I also updated the samples to match the previous coordinates.

What do you think about this?

data.title: Input mousemode updates
data.body:
Some fixes to the input issues that have popped up on the Web platform, and an attempt to make the mouse modes compatible with the Console.

Related issue: https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/issues/917

```
- Added a way to suppress mouse mode and mouse grab changes (SetMouseMode(mode, suppress = false), 
SetMouseGrabbed(grab, suppress = false)), and reset them to a previous unsuppressed state (ResetMouseMode, 
ResetMouseGrabbed).
- Updated Console to react to mouse modes, similarly to mouse visibility previously.
- Console will utilize UI cursor if available.
- Fixed a bug with mouse modes not calling SetMouseGrab correctly.
- Updated samples to use different mouse modes where necessary.
- Updated samples to request pointer lock on mouse down event (Web platform).
- Updated samples that show the UI cursor to show the OS cursor if pointer lock (ie, mouse mode MM_RELATIVE) 
isn't acquired. This conceals a visual bug in UI cursor position (Web platform).
```

data.title: Urho2d fixing
data.body: Fixes a couple of Urho2D issues that are of more immediate need.  Adds setters.

data.title: Add Technique::Clone()
data.body: This should deep copy the technique and all of its passes, for e.g. shader changes. Downside for deep copied passes is that they're considered unique (unique copy = no instancing, unless the copy itself is used in several batches)

data.title: Spritesheet has no obvious way to set texture programmatically
data.body: I am dynamically generating a texture at runtime and am trying to figure out how to assign it to a Spritesheet, however it has no method to set its internal private `texture_` field, only a getter.  The only way to define the texture it seems is via manually crafting a Deserializer to feed it in data for whatever reason, and that only after having created the texture2d and stuffed it into the resource system.  Was there a reason for this being so roundabout or is it missing have a setter for the `texture_` for a reason that I am missing?

data.title: Add Vulkan renderer
data.body:
Hi!

It would be nice to support Vulkan API, since it's [already released](https://www.khronos.org/vulkan/).

data.title: Possible problem at DetourCrowd **integration** causing random segfault at 64-bit build using MSVC compiler toolchain
data.body: Since we have enabled AppVeyor (VS2015) to test run all the sample apps as part of the CI jobs, we have observed random segfault on 64-bit build of 39_CrowdNavigation for both STATIC and SHARED lib types. The problem appears at random and only manifests itself once in a blue moon. 32-bit MSVC builds do not exhibit this problem. CI jobs using other compiler toolchains (Clang and GCC) also do not exhibit this problem in any build configurations and ABIs.

data.body:
It's seems that next iteration start not from the beginning

test files https://github.com/1vanK/MyFiles/raw/master/Temp/LoopedAnimationBug.zip

data.title: fixes #1196 - Filewatcher no longer gets stuck in read() (on linux only)
data.body:
`inotify_rm_watch()` will cause a watching thread to return from `read()`, but this was not possible because the thread was being joined before calling `inotify_rm_watch()`

I moved the call to `Stop()` in `FileWatcher::StopWatching()` after the call to `inotify_rm_watch()` and also ifdef'd the small hack with creating and deleting a file.

data.title: FileWatcher blocks indefinitely on Linux
bug in Terrain::WorldToHeightMap(): 1) rounding error and 2) index offset error
Allow implicit conversions of SharedPtr objects.
data.body:
Cannot see any reason to avoid implicit upcasting of SharedPtr.
This allows not to use `StaticCast` where silent upcasting is possible.
Besides I have changed comparision operators to allow mixed comparisions.
Some testing was performed.

This is my first pull request to test Urho3D collaboration :) so hello everyone!

data.title: Material->Clone() issue
Urho2D Culling issue with camera rotation
data.body:
I am attempting to use Urho2D, however anytime the camera node is rotated (say, with rotate2d), the clipping bounds of the Urho2D nodes appear to be getting constrained on the left/right axis. Easiest way to reproduce it, just open the sample of 24_Urho2DSprite, at the end of the HandleUpdate method just add:

```
cameraNode_->Rotate2D(timeStep*10.0f);
```

Then run it and watch what happens. I am trying to have a follow camera above the 2D player that rotates as the player rotates, however that appears difficult to do when everything becomes invisible at about 45 degrees and on...

It also happens on the 36_Urho2DTileMap sample by adding the same code at the same place, you can watch the tiles vanish at the edges on in.

EDIT:  Putting everything in the world 'but' the players unit and rotating it has no issue other than adding another transformation frame to everything, only rotating the node with the camera causes an issue.

data.title: Bug, when rename rendertarget "blurh"
data.body:
I append commands to "Forward.xml"

```
    <rendertarget name="blurh" tag="Blur1" sizedivisor="2 2" format="rgba" filter="false" />
    <command type="quad" tag="Blur1" vs="Blur" ps="Blur" psdefines="BLUR3" output="blurh">
        <parameter name="BlurDir" value="1.0 0.0" />
        <parameter name="BlurRadius" value="2.0" />
        <parameter name="BlurSigma" value="2.0" />
        <texture unit="diffuse" name="viewport" />
    </command>
    <command type="quad" tag="Blur1" vs="CopyFramebuffer" ps="CopyFramebuffer" output="viewport">
        <texture unit="diffuse" name="blurh" />
    </command>
```

Screen is blurred.
When I rename rendertarget to other

```
    <rendertarget name="blurhs" tag="Blur1" sizedivisor="2 2" format="rgba" filter="false" />
    <command type="quad" tag="Blur1" vs="Blur" ps="Blur" psdefines="BLUR3" output="blurhs">
        <parameter name="BlurDir" value="1.0 0.0" />
        <parameter name="BlurRadius" value="2.0" />
        <parameter name="BlurSigma" value="2.0" />
        <texture unit="diffuse" name="viewport" />
    </command>
    <command type="quad" tag="Blur1" vs="CopyFramebuffer" ps="CopyFramebuffer" output="viewport">
        <texture unit="diffuse" name="blurhs" />
    </command>
```

It is not works.
When I add postprocess in my code

```
void Game::SetupViewport()
{
    Renderer* renderer = GetSubsystem<Renderer>();
    SharedPtr<Viewport> viewport(new Viewport(context_, scene_, cameraNode_->GetComponent<Camera>()));
    renderer->SetViewport(0, viewport);
    auto renderPath = viewport->GetRenderPath();
    auto cache = GetSubsystem<ResourceCache>();
    renderPath->Append(cache->GetResource<XMLFile>("PostProcess/Bloom.xml"));
}
```

screen is blurred again. Tested in OpenGL.
